item.title: Fenwick Tree
item.description: A Fenwick Tree maintains an array of n integers a_0,a_1,\dots,a_{n-1} by maintaining s(i)=\sum_{j=i-\operatorname{lsb}(i)}^{i-1}a_i which costs a space of \mathcal{O}(n).

item.title: Segment Tree
item.description: A Segment Tree maintains an array of n=2^k numbers a_0,a_1,\dots,a_{n-1} by maintaining s(0,2^k),s(0,2^{k-1}),s(2^{k-1},2^k),\dots,s(0,1),s(1,2),\dots,s(2^k-1,2^k), where s(l,r)=\sum_{i=l}^{r-1}a_i which costs a space of \mathcal{O}(n).

item.title: Sparse Table
item.description: A Sparse Table maintains an array of n numbers a_0,a_1,\dots,a_{n-1} by maintaining f(i,j)=\max_{k=j}^{j+2^i-1}a_k which costs a space of \mathcal{O}(n\log(n)).

item.title: Trie
item.description: A Trie maintains a set S of strings in \Sigma^* by maintaining a deterministic finite automaton that accepts and only accepts strings in S.
